USC-DR-RAWCOOKED
  • Functions
  • View page source

Functions

Summary

Each sequence is processed in three stages:

  • DPX Assessment: validity checks on the DPX sequence before processing

  • DPX Rawcook: the cooking process handled by RAWcooked

  • DPX Post Rawcook: validity checks on the MKV, file cleanup and error reporting

The parameters and working of the operations in these stages are listed below. The Utils section contains utility functions used across each stage to setup file structures, setup logging, verify policies or move/copy sequences.

DPX Assessment

dpx_assessment.execute(params: dict) → bool

Performs all assessment functions on a dpx sequence based on preferences specified by the user. They are listed here in order: check if sequence exists, check for gaps in the sequence, check if v2 flag is required, check dpx policy

Parameters:

params (dict) – a dictionary of parameters -> (sequence_path, policy path, rawcooked license, gap check flag, policy check flag)

Returns:

True if v2 required, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

dpx_assessment.check_v2(sequence_path: Path, rc_license: str) → bool

Checks if the reversibility file for a dpx sequence is too big, indicating that version 2 of rawcooked is required.

Parameters:

  • sequence_path (Path) – path to the dpx sequence

  • rc_license (str) – license to run rawcooked

Raises:

RuntimeError – if the rawcooked command fails to run

Returns:

True if version 2 of rawcooked is required, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

dpx_assessment.check_gap(sequence_path: Path) → bool

Checks for gaps and missing frames in a dpx sequence.

Parameters:

sequence_path (Path) – sequence path

Raises:

RuntimeError – if the check fails for any reason

Returns:

True if the sequence has no gaps, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

DPX Rawcook

dpx_rawcook.execute(params: dict) → Path

Parses user preferences and executes the rawcooked command for a dpx sequence.

Parameters:

params (dict) – dictionary of parameters -> (sequence path, output path, rawcooked license, v2 flag, frame md5 flag)

Raises:

RuntimeError – if the subprocess call to rawcooked fails for any reason

Returns:

path to mkv file

Return type:

Path

dpx_rawcook.run_rawcooked(sequence_path: Path, output_path: Path, v2_flag: bool, frame_md5: bool, rc_license: str) → Path

Runs the rawcooked command for the sequence using the preferences specified by the user. After the rawcooked subprocess, the function also generates a .mkv.txt to assess for errors.

Parameters:

  • sequence_path (Path) – path to dpx sequence

  • output_path (Path) – path to output directory

  • v2_flag (bool) – flag to indicate if the sequence requires rawcooked v2 or not

  • frame_md5 (bool) – flag to indicate if rawcooked generates a frame md5 file

  • rc_license (str) – license to run rawcooked command

Raises:

RuntimeError – if the subprocess call to rawcooked fails for any reason

Returns:

path to mkv file

Return type:

Path

dpx_rawcook.grep_with_redirect(pattern: str, source: Path, destination: Path) → None

Redirects data from rawcook logs to a destination based on a grep search pattern.

Parameters:

  • pattern (str) – grep pattern to search

  • source (Path) – path to source file

  • destination (Path) – path to destination file

Raises:

RuntimeError – if the subprocess call to grep fails for any reason

Returns:

None

DPX Post Rawcook

dpx_post_rawcook.execute(params: dict) → None

Performs checks based on user preferences after the rawcook process.

Parameters:

params (dict) – dictionary of params -> (mkv path, policy path, policy check flag)

Raises:

RuntimeError – if there are any missing files, failed policy checks, or other unexpected errors

Returns:

None

Utils

utils.create_execution_dir(output_dir: Path) → Path

Creates an execution directory that acts as a buffer during processing to store the results of each run. The output directory within is created with the format (execution_year_month_day_hour_second) along with a working directory that is deleted post execution.

Parameters:

output_dir (Path) – output directory path specified by user, where the execution directory will be created

Raises:

RuntimeError – if execution directory already exists, or unexpected errors

Returns:

path to the output directory within the execution directory

Return type:

Path

utils.create_working_dir(execution_dir: Path) → Path

Creates the working directory structure in the specified execution directory. The working directory contains subdirectories for policies, logs and the dpx sequence.

Parameters:

execution_dir (Path) – execution directory path specified by user, where the working directory will be created

Raises:

RuntimeError – if execution fails for any reason

Returns:

path to the dpx sequence directory within the execution directory

Return type:

Path

utils.get_log_config(log_directory: Path) → dict

Generates a logging configuration file based on the specified log directory. The console handler is turned off by default.

Parameters:

log_directory (Path) – logging directory path specified by user, where the logs will be created

Returns:

dictionary containing the logging configuration

Return type:

dict

utils.move_logs(wd: Path, output_path: Path, sequence_destination: Path) → None

Aggregates logs generated during an execution to the specified output directory and sequence.

Parameters:

  • wd (Path) – working directory path containing data from every worker

  • output_path (Path) – output directory path where results are stored

  • sequence_destination (Path) – the sequence for which the logs will be moved

Raises:

None

Returns:

None

utils.write_log_config(write_path: Path, driver_path: Path, final_path: Path, count: int, sequence_paths: List[Path]) → None

Creates a JSON file containing log paths to be read by the GUI.

Parameters:

  • write_path (Path) – path where this config will be written to

  • driver_path (Path) – location of driver logs

  • final_path (Path) – location where logs need to be moved

  • count (int) – number of sequences processed

  • sequence_paths (List[Path]) – list of sequence paths containing worker logs

Raises:

None

Returns:

None

utils.find_sequence_path(parent_path: Path) → Path

Finds the dpx sequence directory within the parent directory

Parameters:

parent_path (Path) – parent directory path

Raises:

RuntimeError – if no sequence folder is found

Returns:

path to sequence folder

Return type:

Path

utils.check_mediaconch_policy(policy_path: Path, filename: Path) → bool

Verifies a policy for a sequence by validating a single frame of the sequence against the policy via the mediaconch command

Parameters:

  • policy_path (Path) – path to policy file

  • filename (Path) – path to a dpx frame

Raises:

RuntimeError – if policy check cannot be performed for any reason

Returns:

True if frame is verified, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

utils.check_general_errors(mkv_txt_path: Path) → str

Checks for error messages in the .mkv.txt file and returns them if they exist

Parameters:

mkv_txt_path (Path) – path to .mkv.txt file

Raises:

RuntimeError – if an error occurs for any reason

Returns:

error message if it exists, an empty string otherwise

Return type:

str

utils.move(source_path: Path, destination_path: Path) → None

Moves a file/directory from source_path to destination_path

Parameters:

  • source_path (Path) – file/directory source path

  • destination_path (Path) – file/directory destination path

Raises:

RuntimeError – if source is not found or if it already exists at the destination

Returns:

None

utils.copy(source_path: Path, destination_path: Path) → None

Copies a file/directory from source_path to destination_path

Parameters:

  • source_path (Path) – file/directory source path

  • destination_path (Path) – file/directory destination path

Raises:

RuntimeError – if source is not found or if it already exists at the destination

Returns:

None

utils.sequence_count(sequence_path: Path) → int

Counts the number of dpx frames in a sequence.

Parameters:

sequence_path (Path) – path to sequence

Returns:

number of frames in sequence

Return type:

int
